messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParserTest.testTextExtents()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
2755 :   public void testTextExtents() {
2756 :     parse("@return {@code foo} bar \n *    baz. */", // error occurred here
2757 :         true, "Bad type annotation. type not recognized due to syntax error");
2758 :   }
```

The passing test with the highest token similarity to the failing test looks like:

 ```423 :   public void testParseUnionType12() throws Exception {
424 :     parse("@type {()}*/",
425 :         "Bad type annotation. type not recognized due to syntax error");
426 :   }
```

It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Recorded bad position information
start-char: 14
end-char: 13
	at com.google.javascript.rhino.SourcePosition.setPositionInformation(SourcePosition.java:87)
	at com.google.javascript.rhino.JSDocInfoBuilder.markText(JSDocInfoBuilder.java:172)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParser.extractMultilineTextualBlock(JsDocInfoParser.java:1503)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParser.extractMultilineTextualBlock(JsDocInfoParser.java:1379)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParser.parse(JsDocInfoParser.java:958)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParserTest.parse(JsDocInfoParserTest.java:2984)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParserTest.parse(JsDocInfoParserTest.java:2961)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParserTest.testTextExtents(JsDocInfoParserTest.java:2756)
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.

messages.content:
"
   * Extracts the text found on the current line and all subsequent
   * until either an annotation, end of comment or end of file is reached.
   * Note that if this method detects an end of line as the first token, it
   * will quit immediately (indicating that there is no text where it was
   * expected).  Note that token = info.token; should be called after this
   * method is used to update the token properly in the parser.
   *
   * @param token The start token.
   * @param option How to handle whitespace.
   *
   * @return The extraction information.
   "

Diagnosis of test `testTextExtents`:

The test `testTextExtents` is part of the `JsDocInfoParserTest` class in the `com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing` package. It calls the method `parse` of `JsDocInfoParser` with the following parameters:
- `@return {@code foo} bar \n *    baz. */` (line 2756)
- `true`
- `"Bad type annotation. type not recognized due to syntax error"`

The test failed with the following error message and call stack:
```
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Recorded bad position information
start-char: 14
end-char: 13
	at com.google.javascript.rhino.SourcePosition.setPositionInformation(SourcePosition.java:87)
	at com.google.javascript.rhino.JSDocInfoBuilder.markText(JSDocInfoBuilder.java:172)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParser.extractMultilineTextualBlock(JsDocInfoParser.java:1503)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParser.extractMultilineTextualBlock(JsDocInfoParser.java:1379)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParser.parse(JsDocInfoParser.java:958)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParserTest.parse(JsDocInfoParserTest.java:2984)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParserTest.parse(JsDocInfoParserTest.java:2961)
	at com.google.javascript.jscomp.parsing.JsDocInfoParserTest.testTextExtents(JsDocInfoParserTest.java:2756)
```

Based on the information provided, it appears that the `parse` method of `JsDocInfoParser` encountered an error while trying to extract multiline textual blocks from the given input.

To further investigate, let's take a look at the code snippet of the `extractMultilineTextualBlock` method:

```java
@SuppressWarnings("fallthrough")
private ExtractionInfo extractMultilineTextualBlock(JsDocToken token, WhitespaceOption option) {

    if (token == JsDocToken.EOC || token == JsDocToken.EOL ||
        token == JsDocToken.EOF) {
        return new ExtractionInfo("", token);
    }

    // Rest of the code...
}
```

The `extractMultilineTextualBlock` method takes a `JsDocToken` and a `WhitespaceOption` as parameters. It checks if the `token` is equal to `JsDocToken.EOC`, `JsDocToken.EOL`, or `JsDocToken.EOF` and returns an empty `ExtractionInfo` if any of these conditions are met. Otherwise, it continues with the rest of the code.

Based on the error message and the code snippet, it seems that the error occurred when trying to set the position information for the extracted text. This can be seen from the call stack, where `JSDocInfoBuilder.markText` is called within `extractMultilineTextualBlock`. The error message indicates that there is an issue with recording the position information.

To fix this issue, we need to investigate the `JSDocInfoBuilder.markText` method and its interaction with the `SourcePosition.setPositionInformation` method.

Let's now suggest some methods that could be potential fixes for this issue:

```
com.google.javascript.rhino.SourcePosition.setPositionInformation(SourcePosition)
com.google.javascript.rhino.JSDocInfoBuilder.markText(String, int, int, int, int)
```

These methods are responsible for setting the position information for the extracted text, which seems to be where the bug is occurring. Further investigation and analysis of these methods will be required to provide a more accurate fix.

Please note that this diagnosis is based on the information provided and might not be the exact cause of the bug. Further investigation into the codebase and additional debugging steps may be necessary to confirm and resolve the issue.

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
